column4:
Mix the white cake mix, sugar, water, and eggs.

Spread batter thinly onto two pans and bake 350 F for 15-20 minutes.

Let cool completely

Whip cream and add vanilla and sugar to taste.

Slice a variety of fruit and mix together.

Spread cream over crusts, then add fruit over cream.

Heat preserves and water in microwave for 30 seconds, mix well and drizzle over fruit.

Keep in refrigerator.

Combine flour, sugar, salt, and baking powder.

Cut in the shortening and make a coarse crumb mix.

Make a well in the center, add all liquids at once.

Stir until dough just clings together.

Turn out on a lightly floured board, pat into 3/4 inch thickness.
Using a sharp edged cutter, press out rounds and place on baking sheet

Bake at 425 F for 10-12 minutes

Crack eggs into a microwave safe or steam safe bowl and beat into a homogenous mixture. Season the mixture with salt.

Pour into bowl of water and bouillon mixture or stock. Beat into a homogenous mixture.

To steam using the microwave, loosely cover the bowl with a microwave safe lid and microwave for 1 minute and 30 seconds. 
If not cooked yet, continue to microwave in 30 second intervals. 

To steam using a steaming rack and a pot, fill the pot with water up to the grate and place bowl on top of grate. Cover the pot with a lid and bring to a boil, then lower the heat to let simmer. Steam until cooked, which should take less than 5 minutes.

Crack eggs into a bowl and beat into a homogenous mixture. Season the mixture.

Add oil into a pan and turn on medium high heat. 

Pour in egg mixture and wait for the bottom to cook, then lift the cooked layer for any remaining mixture to cook. Or scramble. 

Set aside cooked eggs and add tomatoes to the pan to cook at medium heat. Season with salt and sugar.

Once the tomatoes are soft and beginning to seep juices, add the cooked eggs back into the pan with the tomatoes. 

Stir to incorporate the tomato juice with the cooked eggs and continue to cook until the tomatoes are to desired doneness.

Add rice to pot of water, bring to a boil then turn heat down to a simmer.

Add chicken bouillon, stir to incorporate.

Add optional ingredients, simmer until desired texture.
column5:
WHEN COOKING: Adjust water to preference. Congee will continue to thicken as it cools.

FOR TASTE: It is recommended to add grated or sliced ginger, sliced spring onion, and soysauce. Other common toppings include fried breadsticks, century egg, and fermented vegetables.

column4:
Cut tomatoes into quarters. Blend water, tomatoes, chicken and tomato bouillon.

Heat oil in frying pan on medium heat. Add rice and cook until golden brown. 

Add blended mixture. Stir and cover pan. Let simmer on low heat for 20 minutes or until all is cooked and there is no water left.

Broil tomatillos and serrano peppers for about 3 minutes. Flip and broil for another 3 minutes. 

Blend tomatillos, serrano peppers, garlic, and onion. Add salt and chopped cilantro.

Heat a pan over medium-high heat. Add water. 

Add chile Japones (can be substituted by chile de arbol), tomatillos, onion, and garlic.

Cook until blistered or charred. Blend and add chicken bouillon and salt.
Blend avocados, serrano peppers, garlic, onion, milk, and salt.

Remove prickles from cactus and wash. Dice cactus. 

Boil water. Add salt and cactus. Boil for 15 minutes. When cactus are cooked, remove from hot water and let cool down.

In a bowl, mix cactus, diced tomato, diced onion, chopped cilantro, pepper, and salt to taste.

Bring corn, potatoes, onion, stock, and pepper to a boil; cover and simmer until potato is soft.

Stir in 1.5 cup milt and butter.

Combine remaining milk and four into a slurry.

Stir into pot, stirring constantly until thick and bubbly.

Cook 1 more minute.

Add ham and heat through.

Saute onion, then add meat and brown.

Add all remaining ingredients and some water.

Simmer for at least 15-20 minutes.

Brown steak in oil. Then remove from pan and cut into cubes.

Brown onion.

Stir in flour.

Add all other ingredients except noodles.

Simmer or put in oven at 325°F for 1 hour.

Serve with egg noodles.

Cook egg noodles.

Brown hamburger, drain excess grease.

Add all ingredients together.

Bake covered for 1 hour at 350°F.
Whisk all ingredients together. Let mixture sit overnight. Butter a shallow pan. Pour batter into pan and let cook until bubbles appear, then flip.

In large fry pan saute onion and garlic. Add meat, brown lightly and drain off excess fat.

Combine together sugar, salt, oregano, rosemary, and parsley.

Add meat together with tomatoes and tomato sauce. Simmer 30-40 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Cook noodles, drain and rinse in cold water.

Place half of lasagna noodles in a 9x13 oven pan. Cover with 1/3 sauce, half of the mozzarella, and half the cottage cheese. Repeat and end with sauce on top.

Bake at 350°F for 30 minutes.

Saute meat in a small amount of oil and remove from pan.

Add onion, saute until soft and remove from pan.

Scramble eggs in more oil if needed.

Return ingredients together in pan and serve.

In a large bowl combine water, oil, and salt. Beat with whisk.

Gradually beat in flour and sour cream, using your hands as it becomes stiff.

After all flour has been added, put on lightly floured flat surface and work until the dough is smooth and no longer sticky.

Put dough in covered bowl and let rest.

Roll out a portion of dough on a lightly floured surface—not too thin—roughly the thickness of a pie crust.

Use a round cookie cutter to cut into circles.

Place approximately 1 teaspoon filling in center. Fold over to make a half circle. Using floured hands pinch edges together.

Drop carefully into salted boiling water to cook, don’t overcrowd the pot. Stir gently and let rise to top—boiling approximately 5 minutes. Drain with a slotted spoon or colander.

Can be fried in butter if desired.

Combine the dry curd cottage cheese, chopped onions, eggs, salt, and pepper. 

Mix until it sticks together when squeezed. This makes approx. 100 pyrogy depending on the size. 

Combine the medium onion chopped finely, cooked mashed potatos, sour cream, grated cheddar cheese, salt and pepper. 

Then mix so it sticks together - chill.

Fry chopped bacon. Add celery and onion. Saute till clear. 

Add water, salt, potato, and soup mix. Cook until potatoes are soft. 

Mash potatoes slightly. Salt and pepper to taste.

Combine all ingredients in sauce pan: beef, beef broth, onion, celery, carrot, garlic, salt, diced tomatoes, barley, and bayleaf. 

Bring to boil. Simmer one hour or till barley is barely cooked. Salt and pepper to taste. 

If extra flavor is needed, add beef soup drymix. 

Remove bayleaf before serving. Serves 4.

Cut beef into 1 inch cubes. Pat dry with paper towel. Heat oil and margarine in heavy skillet. 

Brown meat well - one layer at a time remove from pan - set aside.

Saute onions until golden in color. May need to add a little more margarine. 

Stir in the flour - brown. Add in bouillon and seasonings. 

Return meat to the pan. Simmer partially covered till tender - 1 - 1 1/2 hours. 

This portion may be refrigerated overnight to allow flavors to blend or proceed by adding the vegetables (except peas) cook till tender 30-40 minutes.

Add peas and parsley near the end of the cooking time. 

If the gravy is thin - mix together several tbsp. of flour and water in a jar. Slowly add and stir in stew mixture. Cook until it bubbles and thickens. 

If too thick - add water. 

Add extra beef base granules if needed for flavor.
Saute onion and garlic in a large pot. Add all spices. Once onion is translucent, add tomatos, broth, and chickpeas. Let simmer until chickpeas are soft.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Wash and dry produce. •Drain and rinse chickpeas; dry thoroughly with paper towels, removing as much moisture as possible. 
Halve, peel, and thinly slice shallot; mince a few slices until you have 2 TBSP. Peel and mince or grate garlic. Roughly chop pistachios.
In a medium bowl, toss chickpeas with half the stock concentrates, half the Shawarma Spice Blend, a large drizzle of oil, and a pinch of salt and pepper. 
Spread chickpeas out in a single layer on a lightly oiled foil-lined baking sheet. 
Roast on top rack, tossing halfway through, until chickpeas are slightly crispy, 18-20 minutes. 
While chickpeas roast, heat a large drizzle of oil in a small pot over medium-high heat. 
Add minced shallot, half the garlic, half the pistachios, remaining Shawarma Spice Blend, and a big pinch of salt. Cook, stirring, until fragrant, 30-60 seconds. 
Stir in rice, remaining stock concentrates, and ¾ cup water (1½ cups for 4). Bring to a boil, then cover and reduce heat to low. 
Cook until rice is tender, 15-18 minutes.
Quarter cucumber lengthwise; slice into ½-inch-thick pieces. Halve tomatoes lengthwise. Zest and quarter lemon.
Combine cucumber, tomatoes, and as much sliced shallot as you like. 
Toss with half the lemon zest, juice from one lemon wedge, and a drizzle of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
In a small bowl, whisk together vegan mayo, remaining garlic, remaining lemon zest, and juice from one lemon wedge. Whisk in 2 TBSP water until combined. Season white sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Fluff rice with a fork. Season with salt and pepper. Top with cucumber salad and roasted chickpeas in separate sections. 
Drizzle everything with white sauce and as much hot sauce as you like. 
Sprinkle with remaining pistachios and serve with remaining lemon wedges on the side.

Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil. Wash and dry produce. 
Trim and slice mushrooms into ¼-inch-thick pieces. 
Trim and thinly slice scallions, separating whites from greens.
Heat a large drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. 
Add mushrooms; season with salt and pepper. 
Cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and slightly crispy, 5-7 minutes. T
Turn off heat; transfer to a paper-towel-lined plate. 
Melt 2 TBSP plain butter in pan used for mushrooms over medium-high heat. 
Add scallion whites and cook until just softened, 1 minute. Add flour and cook, stirring, until lightly browned, 1-2 minutes. 
Whisk in milk and 1⁄3 cup reserved pasta cooking water, breaking up any flour clumps. 
Simmer until slightly thickened, 3-4 minutes.
Stir cream cheese into pan with sauce until melted and combined. 
Stir in mushrooms and garlic herb butter. 
Season with salt and pepper. 
Sprinkle with Parmesan and scallion greens.

Halve, peel, and finely chop half the shallot; thinly slice remaining. Zest and halve lemon. Peel and mince garlic. Pick and finely chop fronds from dill. 
Drain and rinse chickpeas; transfer to a medium bowl. Mash with a fork until almost smooth.
In a small bowl, combine sliced shallot and juice from half the lemon. Season with salt and a pinch of sugar. Set aside to pickle. 
In a separate small bowl, combine sour cream, yogurt, lemon zest, half the chopped dill, and a pinch of garlic to taste. 
Add water 1 tsp at a time until mixture reaches a drizzling consistency. Season with salt and pepper.
In a second medium bowl, whisk together tempura mix, Shawarma Spice, salt, and 1⁄3 cup cold water until smooth. 
Stir in chickpeas, chopped shallot, remaining garlic, and remaining chopped dill until thoroughly combined. 
Season with pepper. Wash out bowl used for chickpeas.
Heat a drizzle of oil in a large, preferably nonstick, pan over medium-high heat. 
Carefully add ¼-cup scoops of batter. (TIP: You may need to work in batches.) 
Cook until golden brown and crisp, 3-4 minutes per side. Transfer fritters to a paper-towel-lined plate.
Season with a pinch of salt.
Add rice, water, and salt to pot. Bring to boil, cover, and reduce to simmer for ~20 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Wash and dry produce. Trim and halve zucchini lengthwise; thinly slice crosswise into half-moons. Halve tomatoes. Peel and mince or grate garlic. Zest and quarter lemon.
Heat a drizzle of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add zucchini and cook, stirring, until lightly browned and softened, 5-6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. 
In a second small bowl, combine ricotta, half the lemon zest, ½ tsp olive oil, and lemon juice to taste. Season with salt and pepper.
Place flatbreads on prepared sheet. Evenly spread flatbreads with lemon ricotta. Top with zucchini and tomatoes, cut sides up. 
Bake on top rack until flatbreads are golden brown, 10-12 minutes.
Meanwhile, pick parsley leaves from stems; roughly chop leaves. Mince chives. 
Once flatbreads are done, garnish with parsley, chives, remaining lemon zest, and chili flakes to taste. Drizzle with honey, then slice into pieces.

Mix all, shape into a loaf in a big pan.

Bake at 350°F for 2-2.5 hours.

Place potatoes in pot with enough water to cover entirely
Boil until soft
Drain
Mash until potatoes are broken up but still chunky
Add all other ingredients. Keep mashing until at desired consistency.

Marinate chicken in cornstarch, soysauce, and water mixture. 

Add a small amount of oil in pan or pot and add cut broccoli. Cook for about 2 minutes, then add a fourth cup of water in the pot and cover loosely with a lid to steam.
Let the broccoli steam until preferred doneness. Set the cooked broccoli aside. 

Add a ring of oil to the pan or pot and add the marinated chicken. Cook for about 5 minutes. 

While the chicken is cooking, prepare the mixture of soy sauce, sesame oil, chicken bouillon and water. Also prepare a cornstarch slurry of cornstarch and water in a different vessel.

Stir the chicken in the pan or pot, then add the soy sauce mixture and cooked broccoli. Turn the heat up to medium high, and simmer until chicken is cooked.

Add the cornstarch slurry in the pan or pot, stir and turn the heat down to medium low. The sauce should thicken. Once the cornstarch slurry is dissolved and cooked, the dish is done. Season to taste.

Soak rice noodles in water as per package instructions. Prepare the vegetables as the noodles soak.

Prepare a mixture of soy sauce, salt, and sugar. Prepare another mixture of chicken bouillon and water.

Beat eggs and season to taste. Add a ring of oil to the pot and cook eggs to desired doneness. Set eggs aside. 

Add a ring of oil to the pot and cook choice of meat, add onions and vegetables and saute. Season with curry powder.

Add rice noodles to the pot, use a lifting motion to mix constantly. Add the soysauce mixture. 
Once the rice noodles start sticking to the bottom, add the chicken bouillon and water mixture to loosen the noodles. 
Keep mixing until noodles look cooked and incorporated with the cooked ingredients. Season to taste.
Slice the cucumbers, pat dry, and toss with salt. Let sit for 15 minutes, then rinse off salt and pat dry again. Combine ingredients in a bowl, toss, and store overnight in the fridge

Drizzle 1/4 cup of olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add in the garlic and chili red pepper flakes and cook for a minute or so. Then stir in the tomato paste, then add the tomatoes. Toss in the salt, pepper, and sugar, and simmer on low for at least 15 minutes.

Chop and sautee veggies. Add butter, diced celery and carrots to a large stock pot over medium-high heat. Sauté for 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook for another 30 seconds.

Add stock. Season broth with basil, oregano, salt, and pepper. Add noodles and boil until noodles are al dente. Add cooked chicken.
Butter both sides of bread and place cheese in between, butter side out. Place on hot skillet ove medium heat and grill until cheese is melted and bread is browned.
Saute veggies until soft, add sauce and spices, simmer until heated through. Add meat, mix into sauce until heated through. Add cooked pasta and mix until well combined
Cook grain according to instruction and let cool. Chop fruits/vegetables and place over grain. Place dressing over salad.

Saute shallots/onions and garlic in olive oil over medium heat until softened and translucent.

Add herbs saute until fragrant, add wine and scrape browned bits from bottom of pan. Bring wine to simmer until reduced by half.

Add tomatoes, tomato sauce, and tomato paste. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Cover with lid and simmer for ~30 minutes on low heat.

Season with salt, pepper, and sugar as needed.

Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C), and butter an 8 x 4-inch loaf pan.

In a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas with a fork until completely smooth. Stir the melted butter into the mashed bananas.

Mix in remaining ingredients.

Pour batter into loaf pan.

Bake at 350°F for 55-65 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 400°F. Chill a 9x13″ baking pan in the freezer. Do not grease the pan.

Using a mixer, blend the butter, egg, sugar, and salt together until it is creamy.  Add the flour and vanilla and mix using your hands until the mixture holds together in large clumps. If it seems overly soft, add a little extra flour. 

Using your hands, press the dough out onto the chilled and ungreased baking sheet until it is even and ¼ inch thick.  Dust the top of the cookies evenly with raw sugar.

Bake at 400°F until the edges turn a golden brown, about 12-15 minutes. Remove from the oven. Let cool for about five minutes before cutting the cooked dough into squares. Remove the squares from the warm pan using a spatula.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.

Wash potatoes. Cut into wedges or rectangles. 

In a pan, toss potatoes, oil, salt, and pepper. 

Bake in the preheated oven, turning once or twice, until golden brown and crispy, about 45 minutes.

Whisk together: lime juice, olive oil, garlic, basil leaves, salt, and pepper. Pour over chicken. 

Marinade at least 6 hours. 

Grill or bake chicken in a 350°F oven.

Peel, core, and then chop apples. Sliced hull strawberries. Chop peeled kiwi. Zest orange and juice it. 

Combine prepared fruit, orange zest, orange juice, brown sugar, and apple jelly. 

Serve fruit salsa with cinammon chips.

Bring a pot of water to a boil and add noodles. Follow the package directions for cook time.

In a bowl, combine peanut butter, soy sauce, and sesame oil. 

Once noodles are done cooking, drain and add the noodles to a bowl with the sauce. Mix to incorporate.

Add oil to a pan and turn heat to medium or medium high. Add garlic and stir occasionally to avoid burning. Add bok choy, continue stirring occasionally.

Once bok choy is cooked, or the leaves are wilted, season with salt and oyster sauce.

Marinate chicken in soysauce, cornstarch and water marinade.

Add oil to a pot and saute onions until translucent, add garlic and stir to prevent burning.

Add vegetables and continue to stir while cooking. Season with curry powder, sugar, and salt.

Add water until the ingredients are covered, add chicken bouillon as per the bouillon package instructions. Turn heat up to boil.

Add the marinated chicken to the pot. Lower the heat to medium or medium high and allow to simmer and cook. 

Prepare a cornstarch slurry of cornstarch and water. Once the chicken is cooked, pour in cornstarch slurry to thicken the sauce.

In one pot, boil or steam sweet potatoes.

In another pot, add rice and water and bring it to a boil. 

Turn down the heat to medium or medium high to let simmer until the rice looks thoroughly cooked and the texture of water is thick.

Add cooked sweat potatoes to the pot of rice and simmer until preferred doneness.

Add oil to a pan and turn heat to medium or medium high. Add garlic and stir occasionally to avoid burning. Add green beans and continue to stir occasionally.

Once green beans are cooked, season with salt and fish sauce to taste.

In a large sauce pan, brown beef; drain. 

Add remaining ingredients, except green beans and bring to boil. 

Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender. 

Add beans. 

Cover and simmer 15 more minutes or until beans are tender.
Fill half of a tortilla with cheese and fold. Heat in a pan over medium-high heat until cheese is melted. Flip to brown both sides of tortilla.

Preheat oven to 375°F. 

Brown the ground beef in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Drain excess fat.

Add the onions to the skillet and saute for 4 to 5 minutes until translucent.

Add the garlic and cook, stirring frequently for an additional minute.

Stir in worcestershire sauce and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Transfer ground beef mixture to the prepared baking dish and spread evenly.

Top with cream of mushroom soup, followed by green beans and then cheddar cheese. Be sure to season the green bean layer.

Finally, top with tater tots.

Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until tater tots are golden brown and cheese is melted.

Steep tea bags in 2 cups boiling water for 10 minutes. 

Boil sugar in 4 cups water for 5 minutes and then add lemon juice and flavorings. 

Combine the liquids and heat. Serve hot or cold.

Boil tomatos and guajillo chile in chicken stock. 

Blend tomatos, guajillo chile, chipotle chiles, and garlic. 

Add Adobo Goya All Purpose, salt, tomato bouillon, and oregano to blended mixture.

Heat pan on medium-high heat. Add cooking oil and sliced onion. Fry until tender. 

Add shredded chicken to fry and then add the blended mixture. 

Let simmer on low heat for 10 minutes.

Add water, garlic, onion salt, and Chef Merita Steak and Meat Seasoning to pot with pig feet. 

Pressure cook on high for 45 minutes.

Mix condensed milk, evaporated milk, whole milk, and egg. 

Boil rice in water for 20 minutes and add cinnamon stick. 

When rice is three quarters of the way cooking, add the mixed milk and stir until rice is cooked.

Add hibiscus flowers to cold water. Bring water to a boil. 

As soon as it boils, reduce heat to low and let simmer for 10 minutes. 

Turn off heat and allow concentrate to cool. Pour concentrate through strainer into a pitcher and remove flowers.

Add sugar and stir.

Soak rice for 3-4 hours in warm water with cinnamon sticks. 

After rice has soaked, drain the water. 

Blend rice in water. 

Drain blended rice to remove impurities and blend again if necessary. 

Add rice to a liter of water and mix in condensed milk, evaporated milk, whole milk. 

Add sugar if necessary.

Add lard on high heat to a large pan. Add pork shoulder and stir. 

Add onion, garlic, salt, peper, bay leaf, and water.  

When meat is almost tender, add orange and after 5 minutes add Coca-Cola.

Boil chile guajillo, chile poblano, garlic, and onion for 7-10 minutes then blend. 

In a bowl add salt, oregano, annato, and Chef Merita Steak and Meat Seasoning. 

Add the juice of an orange and the blended mixture. Mix until a thick consistency. 

Season pork shoulder with the rub.

Fry the pork shoulder on high heat until meat is thoroughly cooked.

Mix condensed and evaporated milk, sour cream, and milk. Add chopped strawberries and mix. 
Can garnish with whipped cream and granola.

Wash tilapia. Squeeze lime juice onto fish. Add garlic salt, Goya Adobo All Purpose Seasoning, and pepper to fish. 
Mix water, flour, and the same seasonings used for the fish for a batter consistency. Coat tilapia in batter. 
Heat a pan on high heat and add oil. Fry tilapia until internal temperature of 145.

Mix sour cream, yogurt, condensed milk, and milk until smooth.
Cut apples, peaches, and strawberries in quarter sizes. 
Add and mix in the cut fruits, grapes, almonds, and walnuts to blended mixture.

Prepare a cornstarch slurry of cornstarch and water. Also prepare a bowl of beaten eggs, seasoned to taste.
Bring a pot of water to a boil with bouillon as per bouillon package instructions.
Turn the heat down to let simmer. 
Pour cornstarch slurry in and stir a bit to let incorporate. 
Slowly pour beaten egg mixture into simmering pot of broth in a circular motion. 
Done once the eggs are cooked.

Break eggs carefully into dish.
Slip into salted, boiling water. There should be enough water to entirely cover the eggs.
Remove from heat and cover.
Let stand for 5 minutes or until whites of eggs are firm and yolks are covered with a thin, white film.

Rub meat with salt, pepper, and flour.

Sear meat. Add water. Cover. Cook slowly until meat is tender.

Add vegetables. Cook until tender

Brown carrots, turnips, onions, and tomatoes in hot cooking fat
Add water, cabbage, celery salt, and potatoes.
Season to taste.
Cover and simmer until vegetables are tender.

Add oil, onion and green pepper to a large pan. Cook until soft, about 10 minutes
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute
Mix in the spices, cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, paprika, chili powder and cook for 2 minutes. Add a few drops of water if required
Add the canned tomatoes and passata. Season with salt. Add a pinch of sugar as required. Simmer on low heat until the tomatoes are cooked and thickened
Mix in the chickpeas and cook for 5 minutes
Make little wells in the sauce and add the eggs. Sprinkle the feta over the sauce and cover the pan and cook until eggs are cooked, according to your preference
Garnish with parsley

Melt butter in a saute pan over medium heat. Add mushrooms and garlic, cooking until mushrooms lose their moisture and become soft, about 5 minutes.
Whisk together the egg yolks and whole eggs until evenly mixed. Stir in the parmesan.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil, then add salt and spaghetti. Cook according to instructions on package, until spaghetti is al dente. When finished, save 1 cup of the water that you cooked the pasta in, and strain out the rest.
Very slowly drizzle the 1 cup of pasta water into the eggs, whisking as you pour. This tempers the eggs so that they won't scramble when they hit the hot noodles.
Stir the egg mixture and mushrooms into the spaghetti noodles. Top with cracked black pepper and more parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Prepare rice according to package directions. Cook onion in butter till tender but not brown. Remove from heat; stir in flour.
Drain mushrooms, reserving liquid. Add chicken broth, gradually stir into flour mixture. Add cream. Cook and stir till thick.
Add rice, mushrooms, chicken, pimiento, parsley, salt, and pepper. Place in 2-quart casserole.
Bake in moderate oven (350 °F) for 25-30 minutes.
Makes 8 servings.

Bring a half inch of water to boil in 10 inches covered nonstick skillet. Add green beans; simmer, covered over medium low heat until tender-crisp, about 8 minutes. Drain in colander.
Heat butter in skillet over medium heat, add shallots and sugar; cook until softened and golden, about 2 minutes.  Add salt, pepper, and green beans. Cook, stirring until heated through. About 2 minutes.
Remove skillet from heat and stir in lemon zest and basil. Garnish with lemon wedges if desired and serve immediately.

1. Combine dry ingredients and cut in shortening.
2. Dissolve yeast in lukewarm water. Add to scalded milk, cooled to room temperature.
3. Make a well in center of dry ingredients. Add liquid to dry ingredients and work into dough. 4. Knead dough 15 to 20 times and set aside for approximately 10 minutes.
5. Roll dough to one-fourth-inch thickness or slightly thinner, then cut in squares or triangles and fry inmelted shortening at 420° F. Fry only a few
at a time so fat stays hot. If the fat is hot, the sopaipillas will puff up and become hollow shortly after adding to fat.
6. Drain sopaipillas on absorbent towels and serve as a bread with any New Mexican meal.
They are especially good served with honey.

Rub pork chops with mixture of salt, nutmeg, ginger, and pepper. Brown on both sides in heavy skillet, no fat added. Pour orange juice over pork chops. Cover; reduce heat and simmer 40 minutes. Put 1 cup whole cranberries and 1 tablespoon honey into Osterizer blender container, cover and process at Chop by sliding motor switch On and Off till chopped. Empty into bowl and repeat with remaining cranberries and honey. Spoon cranberry mixture on top of each chop, cover and cook 10 minutes longer. Remove to warm platter. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 450. Lightly dust your work surface and dough with flour. Roll the dough out to about 12 to 14 inches around. With a pastry brush, lightly brush the crust with olive oil and 1 teaspoon of balsamic vinegar. Break apart goat cheese and dot pizza evenly with it. Bake in oven for about 5 minutes, then remove from oven and top with sliced strawberries, prosciutto, and basil. Bake for 5 to 10 more minutes until crust is nicely browned.
Once out of the oven, add sliced arugula leaves, and drizzle with the remaining 1 teaspoon of balsamic vinegar and sprinkle with black pepper. Makes eight slices.

column2: Sausage, Goat Cheese and Arugula Stuffed Peppers
column4:
Heat oven to 400 ºF. Place the peppers on a baking sheet and set aside.
Heat olive oil in a medium skillet set over medium-high heat. Add the sausage and cook until it browns, crumbling with a wooden spoon as it cooks. (If needed, drain the sausage before continuing.) Once the sausage has browned, reduce heat to low and stir in the arugula and goat cheese until the cheese has melted and the arugula is wilted. Taste and add salt, pepper and red pepper flakes, if desired.
Spoon the filling into the peppers and sprinkle each half with Parmesan. Bake for 12-15 minutes, until the peppers have softened slightly. Serve immediately.

Combine sugar and 1 cup water in a small saucepan. Stir to dissolve sugar while mixture comes to a boil. Set aside to cool slightly.
Meanwhile, roll lemons around on your counter to soften. Cut in half lengthwise, and squeeze into a liquid measuring cup. Add pulp to the juice, but discard any seeds. Continue juicing until you have 1 1/2 cups fresh juice and pulp.
Pour 7 cups ice-cold water into a pitcher. Stir in lemon juice and pulp, then add simple syrup to taste. Add ice.

In a saucepan on low heat, combine the chocolate and wine. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes till the chocolate has melted. Stir constantly to prevent burning and take the pan off the heat every few seconds. The mixture will look fairly thick and glossy.
Pour in half the milk and stir to combine, then pour in the rest. Stir again (a silicone spatula is best), then add the water and sugar. Let it simmer for another couple of minutes. Taste and add more sugar if you like, or more milk/water to thin it out further.
Pour into two mugs (for small but satisfying servings, or just use one mug for a large and decadent serving!) and serve hot with whipped cream! As I said in the post above, the red wine flavor is subtle but adds depth to the hot chocolate. If you want a stronger flavor, add splash more in before you drink it. Leftovers can be cooled to room temperature and refrigerated for a day. Reheat on the stove for best results.

In an iron skillet, with a little olive oil cut up 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts
Cook all the about 1 inch or smaller chunks
Add cinnamon, nutmeg, cloves, allspice, cardamom
Add cut and peeled apples, about 4 or 5 (I use red because we always have those)
Add a wee bit of water
Add unsweetened applesauce
Put a frozen pie crust on top
Put a tab of butter on top of crust
Bake at 425 ºF for 20 minutes
Serves 3 or 4 people

Soak your cashews for an hour or two. Drain and rinse well.
Heat oil on medium. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add garlic and ginger. Cook 1-2 minutes. Add garam masala and cayenne. Cook until fragrant. Add carrots, water, and salt. Bring to boil and cook until carrots are very tender.
Transfer to blender (or use immersion blender) and add soaked cashews. Blend until creamy.
Top with a splash of coconut milk, roasted cashews, lime juice/wedges, freshly cracked black pepper, and/or some chopped cilantro/parsley. Serves 4.

column2: Crispy Tofu Stir Fry with Thai Peanut Sauce
column4:
Preheat oven to 400 °F. Line tofu with paper towel or a kitchen towel and place on a plate. Place something heavy on top to drain water out of the tofu. Let sit for at least 10 minutes, or until the oven is heated.
Chop tofu into 1-inch cubes. Toss tofu with olive oil, salt and pepper and spread evenly on a baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, until crispy.
While tofu is in the oven, prepare vegetables. Roughly chop snap peas and bok choy. Add remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil to a large pan. Add vegetables and sauté for about 5-10 minutes, until soft and lightly charred. Set aside.
Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add brown rice noodles. Cook, stirring frequently, for about 5-6 minutes, until soft. Drain and set aside.
In a food processor or blender, combine soy sauce, peanut butter, maple syrup, water, apple cider vinegar and minced garlic. Blend until smooth.
Assemble stir fry: add brown rice noodles, crispy tofu and sautéed veggies to a bowl. Add peanut sauce and mix well to combine. Serve immediately.

Dissolve gelatin in boiling water.
Beat cream cheese until smooth. Gradually add gelatin to cream cheese, beat well. Add marshmallows.
Stir in cold water.
Chill until the consistency of unbeaten egg white. Fold in remaining ingredients.
Pour mixture into a shallow 6-cup mold, cover and chill.
Mix well, use 2 teaspoons to 1 cup boiling water

column2: Creamy Coconut Cashew Spaghetti Squash Alfredo
column4:
Preheat the oven to 400 °F.
Slice the spaghetti squash lengthwise and drizzle 1 tablespoon of oil all over the cut sides of the squash halves and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place cut side up on a baking sheet and bake about 30 to 45 minutes, or until the squash is just tender enough to scrape into strands.
Add the cauliflower florets to another roasting pan or cookie sheet. Toss with the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil, chili powder, salt and pepper. Roast for 25-30 minutes or until lightly charred and golden.
Meanwhile, make the coconut cream sauce. In a high powdered blender or food processor, combine the coconut milk, cashews. lemon juice, nutritional yeast, garlic, salt and pepper. Process until the sauce is completely smooth and creamy. Stir in the crushed red pepper, basil + parsley. Taste and adjust the seasonings to your liking.
Remove both the squash and cauliflower from the oven. Scrape the squash into strands and toss with the coconut sauce. Serve warm with regular parmesan, fresh herbs, or crushed red pepper.

Preheat oven to 375°F.
Wash the sweet potato and prick it with a fork. Microwave until cooked through, about 8 minutes, turning halfway through. Slice open and allow to cool until the steam dissipates and it is cool to the touch.
Place oats on cutting board and roughly chop with a knife to obtain a mixed texture. Thinly slice green onions. Drain and rinse the beans.
In a bowl, combine onions, oats, beans, sunflower seeds, salt, garlic powder, smoked paprika, soy sauce and wine. Mix with your hands and lightly mash the beans with your fingers. Add ½ cup sweet potato and mix to combine.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Form into 4 patties and place on the baking sheet. Bake 20 minutes on one side, then flip and bake 20 minutes on the other side. Cool slightly before serving.

Fry pork until brown. Add onions, add potatoes, season to taste. Cover with boiling water. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Add any additional ingredients. Add milk. Heat to boiling. Blend flour and butter into a slurry and add the slurry. Cook 5 minutes
Additional ingredients can be baked fish, small clams, corn, diced tomato, or parsnips.

Cook linguine according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a large, nonstick skillet, saute the tomatoes, spinach, and onion until tomatoes are softened. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, and garlic salt. Reduce hear. Stir in cheese, until heated through.
Drain linguine, add to sauce.

Preheat oven to 350°F.
Mix all ingredients except blueberries until moist.
Add blueberries.
Bake in muffin tin for 25-30 minutes.
Sprinkle with sugar.

Preheat oven to 425°F.
Cook onion and garlic in olive oil until soft.
Remove onion and garlic from heat and combine the chicken with the remaining ingredients. 
Place chicken mixture on prepared pizza crust.
Bake 10-12 minutes or until browned and warm.

Preheat oven to 375°F.
Mix sugar and eggs together. Then mix in sugar, and then butter.
Mix dry ingredient together and add mix into wet batter.
Fold in bananas and then chocolate chips.
Put in mini or regular sized cupcake tins.
Bake for 20 minutes.

Cut orange in half. Juice the orange for about 3 tablespoons of orange juice. Zest for about 1.5 teaspoons of orange zest. 
Mix garlic, soy sauce, honey, ginger root, orange zest and orange juice in bowl.
Place tenderloins in large plastic zipper bag and pour marinade into bag. Marinate in refrigerator for around 12 hours.
Sray oven-safe pan with non stick cooking spray. 
Place marinated tenderloins on pan and place in oven. 
Roast at 425°F for 25-30 minutes or until internal temperature is 155-160°F.
Let stand 5 minutes. Slice tenderloin to serve.

Preheat oven to 375°F.
Spray oven-safe pan with non stick cooking spray. 
Brush chops lightly with 2 tablespoons mustard.
In a bowl, combine remaining mustard with remaining ingredients.
Coat top and sides of chops with crumb mixture.
Place pork chops in pan.
Roast at 375°F for 20 minutes or until internal temperature is 160°F and crumb coating is brown.
Let stand 5 minutes. Slice tenderloin to serve.

Except for the beef, bell peppers, and mushrooms, combine all ingredients in a bowl. Then add the remaining ingredients, toss to coat.
Thread meat and vegetables alternately on metal or soaked wooden skewers.
Broil 3 inches from the heat, turning often, until meat reaches desired doneness and vegetables are tender. Will take about 12-16 minutes.

Cook unpeeled potatoes in boiling water; let cool.
Peel and shred potatoes coarsely.
In saucepan over low heat, combine cheese and .25 cups of butter.
Stir occasionally until almost melted.
Remove from heat and blend in sour cream, onion, salt and peper.
Fold in potatoes and turn into greased casserole dish.
Dot with butter and sprinkle with paprika.
Bake uncovered at 350°F for 30-40 minutes.

Preheat oven to 450°F. 
In a bowl, mix baking mix, water, and grated cheese until thoroughly moistened.
Drop by spoonful onto a greased baking sheet.
Combine butter with parsley flakes, garlic powder and italian seasoning, then brush mixture onto biscuit dough.
Bake for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.

Preheat oven to 350°F.
Combine shortening, sugar, eggs, milk, lemon zest, flour, salt, baking powder and nuts.
Pour into a greased loaf pan. 
Bake for 40 minutes.
Meanwhile, mix sugar and lemon juice.
When bread is done, poke holes in hot bread with a fork and pour sugar and lemon mixture over bread.
Cool bread in the pan then remove and store until ready to eat.

In a bowl, mix butter, sugar, and eggs.
Add corn meal, flour, salt, and baking powder; combine well.
Gradually add milk, lemon juice, and baking soda.
Pour into greased muffin pan. 
Bake at 350°F for 15-18 minutes.

In a medium bowl, combine chickpeas, tomatoes, peppers, onions, olives, parsley, and oregano.
In a small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, vinegar, salt and pepper.
Pour over chickpeas and stir.
Allow to marinate for about 2 hours.

Whisk oil, vinegar, and garlic in a medium size bowl.
Add remaining ingredients.

In a large bowl, whisk together the sour cream, lemon juice, garlic, dill, salt and pepper until smooth. 
Stir in mushrooms and tomatoes.
Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Mix milk, oil, eggs and pumpkin in a mixing bowl; set aside.
Combine flour, salt, sugar, and baking powder. Add to milk mixture.
Mix only until smooth.
On a hot griddle with a small amount of oil, pour pancake batter, making about a 4-inch pancake.
Flip pancake when bottom of pancake is golden brown. 
Serve hot with butter and syrup or jam.
